00064 // C++11 deprecates std::gets, as it can't be used safely.
00065 // Compilers are starting to remove it from their headers.
00066 #if defined(__cplusplus) && (__cplusplus >= 201103L) || \
00067     defined(_MSC_VER) && (_MSC_VER >= 1900)
00068 #define SC_NO_STDGETS_
00069 #endif

00334 
00335 // USINGS FOR sc_core:
00336 //
00337 // The explicit using for ::sc_core::wait is to remove an ambiguity with
00338 // the constructor for the system's union wait on Unix and Linux. This
00339 // causes problems with aCC, so users of aCC should explicitly select
00340 // the SystemC wait functions using ::sc_core::wait(...). This is actually
00341 // a good idea for SystemC programmers in general.
00342 
00343 using namespace sc_core;
00344 
00345 #if !defined( __HP_aCC )
00346     using ::sc_core::wait;
00347 #endif // !defined( __HP_aCC )
00348 
00349 #ifdef SC_USE_SC_STRING_OLD
00350         using   sc_dt::sc_string_old;
00351         typedef sc_dt::sc_string_old sc_string;
00352 #endif
00353 #ifdef SC_USE_STD_STRING
00354         typedef ::std::string sc_string;
00355 #endif
00356
